sample

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class holds almost all of the code that will be executed during this project, including event handling and connecting to the data base.
    Author:
    jbturner

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The Event Handler for the "Add Product" Button.
      void handleGenButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      A method for the Employee tab to generate the Employee's username, password (if their desired password is invalid), and email, returned to them in a TextArea via a toString method from the Employee class.
      void handleRecordButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Event handler for when the "Record Production" Button is clicked by the user, which will add the selected quantity to the Production Log's textbox.

      A method to add a product's information to the Production Log.

      • handleButtonAction

        public void handleButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The Event Handler for the "Add Product" Button.
        Parameters:
        event - This is the event that is activated when the button is pressed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - These are any SQL problems that occur within the code.

      • handleRecordButtonAction

        public void handleRecordButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Event handler for when the "Record Production" Button is clicked by the user, which will add the selected quantity to the Production Log's textbox.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - The actionEvent is the User clicking the button.

      • textSetter

        public void textSetter(Product newProd)
        A method to add a product's information to the Production Log.
        Parameters:
        newProd - The New Product's information to be added to the Production Log

      • handleGenButtonAction

        public void handleGenButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        A method for the Employee tab to generate the Employee's username, password (if their desired password is invalid), and email, returned to them in a TextArea via a toString method from the Employee class.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - The action event is the user clicking the button.
